snippet: A Brookings Institution survey found that nearly half of the world’s poorest cities never suffered any decline from the Great Recession, and most of those that did have recovered.
abstract: Floyd Norris Off the Charts column on Brookings Institution survey that found nearly half of the world’s poorest cities never suffered any decline from the Great Recession, and most of those that did have recovered.
